comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I think this must be en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Spencer-Churchill,_10th_Duke_o... the elder son of the former Consuelo Vanderbilt and the 9th Duke of Marlborough. BTW, I believe his title should be "Marquess" not "Marquis," but the mis-spelling is common. A 1934 portrait is in the UK National Portrait Gallery at www.npg.org.uk/collections/search/portraitLarge/mw65606/J...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: And www.npg.org.uk/collections/search/portrait/mw172279/Consu... is a 1910 portrait of Consuelo with her two sons. The left-hand boy is clearly (if you choose to look at the larger image) the same person a few years younger than this young man. The photo is by Rita Martin and the National Portrait Gallery also has a copy of Country Life with the same photo on the cover.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The sun. (New York [N.Y.]). December 07, 1919, Section 7 Magazine Section, Image 89 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030431/1919-12-07/ed-... features a full page on his engagement under the headline, Britain's Great Matrimonial Catch, Heir to Vanderbilt Millions, Engaged. The photo is clearly of the same young man.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: swanq: Thanks for uncovering additional information here.  We'll include more complete name information for him next time we update.
